column4: hmmm...I guess I expected to hear some votes for reiserfs or something :)
I've used ext3 in the past...thought it might be a good idea to hear more about other choices
I think most people use ext3 even if they're aware of other choices.
doesn't sound like many votes to stray from tried-n-true
This is the point; ext3 IS tried, and it is very true. I love it.
you would need to boot from the CD
I'm running from a live CD right now....you just need to make sure you system BIOS is set to boot from CD before local drive
another option besides resetting the boot order in the BIOS would be if your system has a boot menu
like on a Dell, I believe you can hit F12 to get a boot menu
it's been quite awhile since the last time I partitioned a disk for a fresh Linux install...I need to go figure out how many partions I need, and how big to make each one
I have one swap partition and one regular partition.
